result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan B Thom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery AMENDED FROM SUBSTANTIAL BATTERY - INTEND BODILY HARM, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay restitution during the pendancy of probation - Joint and Several.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victims or co-defendant's - including by social media. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant to serve 2 weekends. 
Report on Friday 10/16 at 6pm
Release Sunday 10/18 at 6pm
Report Friday 10/23 at 6pm
Release Sunday 10/25 at 6pm
Defendant cannot report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances. Absolute sobriety is required. 
Credit for time served only if revoked.

Defendant Ryan B Thom in court with attorney Robert William Keller.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, A.J.B. (person, property, residence or family).  No contact with the co-defendant M.K. (person, property, residence or family).  No weapons.  You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Ryan B Thom in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Ryan B Thom in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.
